intro: Rondeletia clarendonensis, commonly known as the Clarendon rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
